326BEF51CA5E470CB49D9D9776B29E41.description: one-way speaking or writing that does not allow for real time clarification of meaning. This means that the speaker/writer has to be sure to “fill in the gaps” and have a solid understanding of what the listener or reader knows or needs to know to interpret the message.

DA3BCF0F2BF44F68BD9171F1E89EB025.description: is two-way speaking that allows for clarification of the message in real time. When communicating interpersonally all speakers and listeners are involved in creating and interpreting the message and work together to assure that there is a collective understanding.

BFA65F9D257D467A9F88076AD25A274D.description: one-way listening or reading that also does not allow for real time clarification of meaning. When reading and listening in this context the reader/listener needs to fill in their own gaps in understanding. This may require accessing personal knowledge of the topic or doing research. The most effective tool is the use of context clues and identifying what is understood to make meaning globally.

CCF8901612C1426BBD176693D70DF492.description: Applies qualitative and quantitative reasoning and appropriate mathematics to describe or explain phenomena in the natural world at the micro and macro level.

29386DB56BAC4388986B20BFB9E078AD.description: Applies knowledge of the scientific process to integrate and synthesize information, solve problems and formulate research questions and hypotheses; is facile in the language of the sciences and uses it to participate in the discourse of science and explain how scientific knowledge is discovered and validated.

CDDD803C27DA4852B4FCFBF6E45A35FB.description: Gather, organize and describe characteristics of data in context, using appropriate theoretical models to explore relationships among variables and predict the unknown.

FD40B29DC180494A80BD72FB5BB48711.description: Solve a range of complex problems, making productive use of knowledge and problem solving strategies.

8CCC91E49B8346A2A181410212DECC76.description: Apply mathematical concepts and carry out mathematical procedures with precision and fluency.

7FA9DEFA49E34CF28FA31D5DDDB4B392.description: Student can locate (library), collect (source evaluation), organize (sort), cite (Chicago) and utilize both primary and secondary sources that are appropriate, accurate, specific, logical and relevant as the preliminary step of creating an argument.

C722AA02F94B4453BA1557E916D779D4.description: Student applies and demonstrates knowledge of major eras, enduring themes, turning points, and historical influences to analyze the forces of change in the community, state, United States or World.

1A25DDF713224FD9B91141185E8DC74D.description: Student is able to communicate, advance, and defend a claim both orally and in writing, by demonstrating an understanding of alternative perspectives (historiography?), interpreting evidence, and employing historical reasoning in an organized argument. (managing the writing process)

49B5D8A771F64BB0B0F816F239EF895A.description: Can identify, express, and analyze subtext; Makes connections across texts/genres; Understands/expresses director-viewer relationship; Analyzes composition, narrative structure, metaphor/symbol, tone, audience, purpose; Identifies, extracts, and utilizes textual evidence

2A367A0A0C1D4D6297E2E6137687EB7A.description: Can identify, express, and analyze subtext; Analyzes diction, structure, metaphor/symbol, tone, audience, purpose; Understands/expresses author-reader relationship; Identifies, extracts, and utilizes textual evidence

93E827A3F6E34698BEA55296955FA62F.description:
"Mastery of the full-length piece in multiple genres for multiple audiences; Mastery of foundational mechanics: syntax, paragraph structure; Well-developed, strong voice; Independently employs revision strategies; Seamless synthesis/integration of external ideas, texts, sources; Reflects sophistication of analysis/thought, originality
"

D2811EF7B6B34D78973AFB06ECA9F21C.description: Understand the collaborative nature of the arts. Learn the value of interaction, and working towards a common goal. Be able to empathize and give supportive feedback and gain acceptance of diversity.

F37C5D7B48244002BAA3F4D98E06098C.description: Demonstrate the ability to persist in creating truthful and compelling art

B42F12D21C424B9A93D05944793EC4E6.description: Make informed assessments regarding the quality of artistic works.

4D8350722835493E884FF7DB2F78A14D.description: Demonstrate the ability to generate new ideas, that add, connect, or create insight.

6B9DA12B3779494EA5E5332460212B08.description: Be able to express oneself through the art form.

25B47AE1D2A3474CB9A274640F303CE4.description: Articulates a complex understanding of cultural differences in verbal and nonverbal communication (e.g., demonstrates understanding of the degree to which people use physical contact while communicating in different cultures or use direct/indirect and explicit/implicit meanings) and is able to skillfully negotiate a shared understanding based on those differences.

4F3A52D2BA2B4D10BBEE3FB082DB770F.description: Interprets intercultural experience from the perspectives of own and more than one worldview and demonstrates ability to act in a supportive manner that recognizes the feelings of another cultural group.

C3C0C351518B4D3B9809C166DB4B9A61.description: Demonstrates sophisticated understanding of the complexity of elements important to members of another culture in relation to its history, values, politics, communication styles, economy, or beliefs and practices.

D5367AD2D2DF4CC6AC3439B2B4576953.description: Articulates insights into own cultural rules and biases (e.g. seeking complexity; aware of how her/his experiences have shaped these rules, and how to recognize and respond to cultural biases, resulting in a shift in self-description.)

3915A52CB8314895AFC234E3F8658ED6.description: The ability of a person to effectively interact, work, and develop meaningful relationships with people of various cultural backgrounds. It goes beyond tolerance, which implies that one is simply willing to overlook differences. Instead, it includes recognizing and respecting diversity through our words and actions in all contexts.

CEA199BFFD614997950742E28F24A813.description: Solve a range of complex problems, making productive use of knowledge and problem solving strategies.

332B91C87BAB4962BB7A8C16C589E6A6.description: Demonstrate a proficiency in using analysis, critical thinking, and logical methods to make good decisions and solve problems.

9ECA5CFAA3E34FB7A54B0106580940CA.description: Student demonstrates the ability to use learned ideas to create a body of work..

83F53D62CEF0422682CEF4B083BFD51C.description: Student demonstrates the ability to generate new ideas, bodies of work, or novel business ventures that add to, connect, or create insight into existing contexts or content.

A419F2C3A16F41D49D91EE3ACF311CE8.description: Goals are set and deadlines constantly met without self-inflicted undue stress to the student. is able to assess what equipment will be needed for learning and has it ready.

42DAEE8893C34A259B75DCBCCCB4A2D8.description: Student recognizes and produces high quality work that is organized properly, contains content specific information, is truthful, and is presented properly giving ownership where due.

5F152EC7C8F249E9972EB2FF7F39857D.description: The student demonstrates responsibility, engagement, risk-taking, effort, confidence, self-awareness, adaptability, and initiation to follow one’s passions as they take ownership of their learning.

FF6B5E340B7D41F995FB0120630017E1.description: Understand the collaborative nature of learning. Recognized the importance of interacting and working towards a common goal. Be able to empathize and give supportive feedback and gain acceptance of diversity.

B55F5BC1D5D3431AB5F0C0F6DF3CE165.description: Student acts with integrity to resolve conflict, assume responsibility for behavior, demonstrate diversity, tolerance, and empathy to help maintain a safe and supportive environment, individually and in a group contributing to one’s school community and world.

C49F663118F24C44B8A7CD9C2F33DA33.description: Understand the collaborative nature of the arts. Learn the value of interaction, and working towards a common goal. Be able to empathize and give supportive feedback and gain acceptance of diversity.

6D0F8B9762634F68971467F006A21DEF.description: Student is able to recognize when information is needed and have the ability to locate, evaluate, and use effectively the needed information.

B387BDFC690A4BBFB4AF83440375EC6B.description: Student can generate, develop, organize, and convey original ideas using media (for example, digital texts, images, and graphs) to present those ideas clearly, confidently, and in a manner appropriate to different audiences.

4DA7D2D6035940CAA7F449F7CF974D38.description: Student can generate, develop, organize, and convey original ideas using media (for example, digital texts, images, and graphs) to present those ideas clearly, confidently, and in a manner appropriate to different audiences giving credit to ownership when due.

E00C616B28A444FB8237854364AB8CC8.description: Student can generate, develop, organize, and convey original ideas orally, using language, presentation skills, and/or other media (for example, digital texts, images, and graphs) to present those ideas clearly, confidently, and in a manner appropriate to different audiences giving ownership when due.
